Reviews.Title: “good location, breakfast, cheap........”
Reviews.Author: james l Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: i stayed here for two nights and cant complain the rooms were abit small but u get used to it. nice place would go back again :)

Reviews.Title: “Not bad at all and excellent value for money.”
Reviews.Author: BirminghamJimbo
Reviews.Content: It's slap bang in the centre and close to the main attractions. Its clean, its safe, and it had a good atmosphere in the bar. The staff are friendly enough and its is cheap. Its a no frills experience in the room but the beds are comfy and there is a tv with various cable channels. You do have to share a toilet/shower room but there are only four rooms on each floor and each floor has its own seperate toilet and shower. If you want to have more facilities then pay the sky high prices of other hotels in the area, otherwise save your money and stay in this no frills but pleasant enough little hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, good service - but nothing for claustrophobics”
Reviews.Author: Oliver U Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Located right in the Redlight District "De Wallen", admidst pubs and eateries this hotel offers clean rooms with shared facilities. It is managed by Laura, a straight forward woman who makes sure that everything in the hotel is running according to her guidelines. While the breakfast room doubles as an authentic english pub in the evenings, steep steps lead up to the first and second (and third?) store where the rooms are located. While the rooms and facilities are kept reasonably clean, they are certainly not on the spacious side of life. No problem if one is out of house for most parts pf the day. Televisions in the rooms are placed immediately under the ceiling, which makes watching a little bit of an artistic exercise. But then again, you are not in Amsterdam for watching TV.. All in all a recommendable place to stay for a couple of days.

Reviews.Title: “wtf???”
Reviews.Author: ryan b
Reviews.Content: was at this hotel recently and was shocked when informed on arrival that you had to be in the hotel by 2-3 am or you would be locked out. bar tender also very grumpy and not very helpfull

Reviews.Title: “Old Nickel Amsterdam â€“ never stop there!!!”
Reviews.Author: Elena_Sviridova
Reviews.Content: It is the worst hotel which I ever met. I will never stop any more in this hotel. Very small and very cold room; very big cracks in windows; a shower on a floor, water in a shower is cold or very hot (normal was never); a rusty watering can sticks out in the wall, water splashes in different directions, to get under the water stream is impossible; ventilation in shower is terrible, in three minutes after turning on the water all is filled up with steam. The breakfast is tasteless. The staff is rough. From pluses â€“ wi-fi and immediate proximity to railway station. I have only one photo of a room. It was impossible to make other photos, because the room is very small. Old Nickel Amsterdam â€“ never stop there!!!

Reviews.Title: “DONT GO TO THEIR HOTEL SCHAGEN”
Reviews.Author: CHRIS43XXX
Reviews.Content: we just got back from amsterdam on the 11th sept was booked in old nickel, ended up in the hotel SCHAGEN, what a dump we was put in room 4 we are a couple in our 40s, and we have travelled a lot of places and not fussy where we stay somewhere to get ur head down , but this DUMP was 2 single beds in a room about 5 foot wide and 15ft long so beds were either end of each other it needs 2 be decorated from top to bottom, so when we went back to the lady who booked us in a SCOTTISH woman who was very nice when we booked in, but the old hag soon showed her true colours when we complained, basically she told us we have had ur money END OF, so be very careful if u have booked in this place before u hand any money over u want 2 find out where u are staying i cant comment on the old nickel or old quater their sister hotel as we wasnt in either but serious dont stay in the SCHAGEN, yes the stairs are winding and steep there but that didnt bother us its the state of the rooms or our room should i stay i can only presume they r all the same, i dont want someone else parting with their hard earned money to stay there, like i told the scottish nasty woman why r u deceiving people u havent got the SCHAGEN on ur website or its not mentioned that u will be in there cos i really cant see how it can be passed as a HOTEL unless the person was BLIND who inspected it YOU HAVE BEEN WARNED, oh yeah location is fantastic pity i couldnt say that about the schagen or the scottish hag

Reviews.Title: “Superb location”
Reviews.Author: suzKL
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights and paid EUR150 for twin rooms (EUR75/night). I have a mixed feeling on this hotel. We are located on top floor, steep staircase. We request for lower floor but receptionist said it's fully booked. I think she's telling the truth cause after a few minutes, two female asking for a hotel room but receptionist mentioned it's fully booked. It was school holiday in UK at that time. I guess many ppl travelling. Hotel location is great. Walking distance to Centraal Station and Red Light District. Centraal station is the place you can get tram/train/bus to tourist place eg Keukenhof, Zaans Schans, Van Gogh Museum.

Reviews.Title: “I would not recommend this hotel for your stay in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: meliscl
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for one night only, and that was more than enough. It was very small, and we did not even sleep in the bed, just felt dirty. There is no lift, so if you got a big bag like us, its not a good idea as they fill the hotel from the top floors, we were on the top! There is also just shared bathrooms and NO view of Damrak as mentioned on the website. You also need to hand in your key at reception, so anyone can go into your room, and I find that very uncomfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Basic accommodation, good location”
Reviews.Author: rscary
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Schangen Hotel even if we booked at the Old Nickel. Long and narrow room in the highest floor (third). Very small and very steep stairs access. Beds separated and distant with no possibility to merge them. Style essential, a bit old and not well kept, sufficiently clean. Free wireless connection. Separate bathroom and shower, very basic and sufficiently clean. Breakfast with tea, coffee, bread, jam, butter and, bacon and eggs, served in the Old Nickel pub (50 metres distance). Friendly staff. Perfect location, close to train station and city centre. The cost is similar to the average cost of this type of accommodation in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Not exactly a hotel...horrible experience...”
Reviews.Author: MRB98
Reviews.Content: Not exactly a hotel (a pub, with very old, stinky, dirty bedrooms upstairs). Rooms not ready at the expected time. Personnel complained about us having a 3 year-old child with us, against their own policy of children under the age of 5 staying for free. The man who "welcomed" us was ironic, unpleasant, and extremely rude, to the extent that we payed for the room and left without staying there. Horrible experience.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastically convenient”
Reviews.Author: Musicker
Reviews.Content: I spent a night here and easily found the hotel from Central Station. It's most conveniently situated, with lots of good eating places within 50-100 metres. The downstairs pub has an excellent selection of good and unusual beers, and my reception was friendly and professional. My single room was tiny, but perfectly sufficient. All was clean, and sharing a bathroom wasn't a problem. There was some noise in the early hours from returning residents (it was a Saturday night) but ear plugs worked well. I would definitely stay here again if visiting Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, limited services: very good for travelling in budget”
Reviews.Author: MrDenan
Reviews.Content: Low price for a great location and limited services. If you want to avoid hostels and stay in a twin or double room without great service or great facilities, that is your place. It is definitely not clean (old carpet, etc), but for a good price it is a perfect decent place to stay. If you are looking for some luxuries, you won't find them there. If you want just for a good price a bed, decent shower and toilet and a good breakfast, you will get it for a very reasonable price. We stayed in a different building in the same street than the reception (a pub). Much better, I'd say. It is called "Schagen". They gave us keys (warning us about lossing them) and we could enter or leave in any moment. It is like having a little apartment for few days. But this has a bad point if a crazy british guy starts to freak out at 5 in the morning in other room, shouthing and beating. There is no reception to complain (the pub it is closed for some hours during the night). The breakfast, served in the pub, is two eggs with bacon, toasts with jam and tea/coffe. No juices, fruit or other stuff. Good for me. Towels are provided and changed everyday; I'm not sure about sheets (they appeared straigthen). The shared facilities are ok; good shower. The staff is people just of few words, not very funny, but never rude. Smoking weed and hash is allowed in the rooms if you "open the window". By the way, the coffeshop in front of the hotel is crap, the worst in the town. Rude and stupid staff, small variety. AVOID IT. Waste of time and money; much better places in the area (the location is great).

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Nicki1918
Reviews.Content: The hotel is fab, right in the heart of everything, a bit noisy but thats what you get for being right in the middle of everything, the service was excelent, the staff lovely, and i will defo be going back there to stay, very good value for money, The showers take a bit of getting used to, my advice turn the cold on full, then just a little turn of the hot tap, but be carefull it does get very hot. The hotel was very clean i could not fault it, and Amsterdam is a fantastic city.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: louisamayes
Reviews.Content: First night was very noisy with some guests arriving at 3am then all taking showers (one shower per floor) as walls are paper thin we were woken for some time! rooms only have single beds so bare this in mind if you are a couple ;-) breakfast was simple but fine with bread butter jam, fried egg and bacon and coffee. Rooms were very warm which was great as amsterdam was sunny but cold when we stayed! beds were comfortable but rooms were small but expected for the price. The downstairs of the hotel was the best part as it is a brown cafe with 60 beers on offer! When you come back after a night out its nice to be able to get a drink in your own private pub! :-) one main problem was the showers which really need sorting as there are only 2 settings boiling hot or freezing cold! I would stay here again for location and price are great!

Reviews.Title: “Standard.”
Reviews.Author: martinr87
Reviews.Content: Just got back home after spending 4 nights at the Old Nickel, First off all it is really easy to find and very close to central station. Literally just come out of the station, across the main road and its on the left. On arrival we were greeted by a scottish lady who at first seemed a bit stern but was actually a good laugh and very nice. as where all the hotel staff. She then explained about breakfast which was between 7:30 -10:00, although none of our group managed to get up early to sample the breakfast so i can't comment on the quality of it!.... we paid 135 euros each for the stay which to me seemed a bit much but i don't really know how that compares to other places in amsterdam. for the people staying in the main building there was a 4am curfew (although i think this depended on how long the person looking after the hotel bar felt like staying.. ) but it was secure, the key had to be left behind the bar and guest's had to be buzzed up to the room's. None of this applied to the people in the annex who had their own room key to be kept at all times and could come and go as they pleased. As said about the location it was very near the station, and also very close to the red light district. so in general Its probably in the ideal location for a group of friends. or anyone wanting to be near the red light infact. The room was pretty basic. we stayed in quad rooms, which had 4 beds, a sink in the corner and one table. There was also a tv which had a good selection of channels including BBC 1. the toilet was shared between the rest of the floor aswell as the shower. The shower however was awful, it was impossible to get the right temperature. It was either boiling hot or freezing cold. the windows where also very thin and made it very noisy off the street. Another slight minor point was our bed sheets were not changed at any point and i think we were only given clean towels on one occasion also. I would most probably stay here again as i feel the location was great and it had everything we needed for a group of lad's. 4 members of our group had to stay in the annex which was just down the road.

Reviews.Title: “Booked this hotel and was a little bit...”
Reviews.Author: BenB88
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel and was a little bit apprehensive after looking at the reviews and seeing some negative feedback; what a gamble it was! When we first arrived we were greeted in a really friendly and warm manner by a Scottish lady who works in the bar, she then sorted our keys etc and explained we were in a separate building about 20 yards away. We were all set in our room 5 minutes later and ready to engage amsterdam! IGNORE ALL BAD REVIEWS! This is a perfect hotel for the money, no complaints!! Clean towels everyday, great breakfast (included), perfect location and really friendly staff. Will definitely stop here again and recommend the Old Nickel to anyone who asks! Thanks to all the staff.

Reviews.Title: “"THE PERFECT AMSTERDAM EXPERIENCE"”
Reviews.Author: texastravelgal54
Reviews.Content: This place was exactly what i excected it to be clean comfortable and cheap!! The breakfast was perfect and free every morning. The bar in the main hotel was the greatest....the day bartender "ELLEN" what can i say we just loved her!! I hope to some day go back and i will stay at this hotel again!! The location was perfect, it was with in walking distance of every thing you could want food and drink and just people watching!! LOVED EVERY MINUTE Holly Bryan Fort Worth Texas

Reviews.Title: “perfect hole in the wall”
Reviews.Author: sdotdesign
Reviews.Content: we stayed here in 2005... when you walk in to the hotel, the reception area is a bar! this was great at night at everything in amsterdam closes by 1am I believe and the lady at the bar told us if we were not back by 2 am we sleep in the street... the room was comfortable, 4 twin beds and a sink on the wall. there was a community shower right next door to us, with water so hot that we actually set off the fire alarm with the steam! very clean and comfortable hostel.

Reviews.Title: “great place”
Reviews.Author: alba69Skye
Reviews.Content: I am just back from ten nights at the old nickel , this is my 3rd stay there , after a break of several years due to a accident i returned and after reading the reviews i was worried what i would find , i had a single room on the first floor just as i had asked for , my room was spotless , not a big room but all you do is sleep in it , it had a tv with 30 pluss chs , a wash basin , wardrobe , etc , my bed sheets were changer every 3 days , and the toilet and shower on the first floor were spottless, , you get a bacon and egg omelette with bread and jam and marmalade and as much tea and coffee as you can drink ,.i had no complaints about the staff , the hotel is 2 mins from central staion and 2 mins from the warmastrat , and 5 mins from the zi dyke which leads on to china town , at no time did i feel unsafe , the hotel is just one out of 4 that is owned by a american doctor , i have stayed in several hotels from the budget old nickel hotel to 5 star hotels and every one allows smoking in the rooms , i dont smoke but it didnt bother me , the hotel is secure as you are not allowed to take the key out with you and you must be buzzed into get up to your rooms , the hotel also has a hostel style annex , it has the old quarter hotel round the corner , and it does excellent food , best spare ribs i have tried yet , i will be staying there again , and while i was there i met several people who are all repeat customers , there was one older guy there who stay for 17 days several times a year , one of the ladies that works at the old nickle , took the guy to arman on her day of , which i thought was nice thing to do for him ,its not a fancy hotel but a budget hotel ,i am lucky enough to afford a higher star rating hotel if i wished , but i get everything i need there , and the hotel bar has over 60 excelent beers , tye only down fall i have with the hotel is the live music they have 3 nights a week is rubbish , some local guy called peter lavell . cheers murdo , skye

Reviews.Title: “It's terrible, don't stay here!!! You life is worth so much more....”
Reviews.Author: shotenzenjin
Reviews.Content: Oh my god!! I booked this hotel on Easy book.com. What a huge mistake. In the heart of the red light district, not clear on google maps, I was verbally harrassed on the street by a man who thought that was a way to woo a lady. As a woman travelling alone I didn't feel safe at all (the Guide book lied when it said this area was fairly harmless). I arrived at night and the hotel owner, grumpy old man, had an altercation with a potential customer because he wanted to stay for 2 nights (not the 1 night that the hotel could offer him) completely unprovoked. I stupidly paid for my room before seeing it only to find a box for my single room which stank of cigerette smoke (It must be the only hotel in the world that allows people to smoke inside the room). It was dirty, and dark as it overlooked other windows and a dirty roof top. Easy book didn't make the location or the room description clear (and also I didn't take proper precautions to look, never again!!) It was room only with a shared shower and toilet which was fine on paper, but when I realised most of the clientele were single men travelling alone (needing hotels in the red light district.. mmm what for I wonder?), going to the toilet also became a health and safety risk. Thankfully the hotel staff in the morning where nice enough but too late for me. At 100 euros for 2 nights this place was ridiculously over priced even for a 2 star hotel. There wasn't even any information about what there is to do in and around amsterdam as the hotel was on top of a pub. The next morning, after a just about edible breakfast of salty omelette. I moved to another 2 star hotel, Hotel clemens, in the Jodaan district (beautiful part of amsterdam); I paid 75 euros for a beautiful room. The hotelier gave me a single rate for a triple room because that's all she had left (how lovely). I had my own shower and toilet and a lovely view, breakfast was full of continential delights and there were discount vouchers, maps etc. on everything there was to do in amsterdam. Worth every penny!!! Please stay here you're worth it. xx

Reviews.Title: “Been there, Done that”
Reviews.Author: bb_organic
Reviews.Content: This place was recommended to me by an unlikely source, a French woman who seemed to value elegance and wine over seediness and beer. I took her advice and while I don't regret it, I would not really go back again. I was there mainly to be near the train station for my 24 hour layover. The room was spare and noisy, and the whole place had a layer of grime.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this place like the plague”
Reviews.Author: craigybell
Reviews.Content: This was a good hotel at first. The location and price were second to none. Well thats the good bit. Now for the bad. After we returned home both my wife and i had bites up and down ours backs and arms from the dirty rampant bed bugs. The bbreakfast consists of a so called omlette and bits of bacon. The guy on reception at night wasnt very pleasent. The room itself was dirty. The toilet is pure unhygenic and should be hosed down with some kind of super industrial bleach. I suppose you get what you pay for. But ive now stayed in a couple of 1 star hotels and never been as dirty as this. Im getting itchy now just thinking of those bed bugs. Our bedroom window opened up on to a roof that had everything lying on it from mouldy socks to half eaten take aways. there is no air conditioning so if going in the summer be prepared to sweat. Do not book a room at this hotel there is so much more for the same amount of money. Book at your own risk. If youve already booked be sure to pack cream/ointment for bed bug bites.

Reviews.Title: “Ignorant old Scottish receptionist”
Reviews.Author: John9991
Reviews.Content: Decent hotel, good value for money and quite clean. All good except for the ignorant old Scottish receptionist. Everything she says is right and she wont listen while she verbally abuses everyone and everything around her. What an old hag!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Londonwest82
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Old Nickel for the weekend, the location is great a two minute walk from Central station, with restaurants bars and ofcourse coffee shops just round the corner.The old Nickel is a decent budget hotel & found the staff friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Bitey”
Reviews.Author: hjjhhhhh
Reviews.Content: The location and staff at the old nickel are both great - very accomodating, and a good atmosphere, but we were attacked at night by bed bugs - I'm still itching nearly a week later. This was the only downside to our trip, but a big one! Next time I travel I'll be looking to pay that little bit more, and come home with all my blood in my veins!

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay there”
Reviews.Author: Antonio1984
Reviews.Content: The hostel was not more than ok (it's a hostel not a hotel, be aware of that), the shower is a Venetian shower, so after one of us had a shower the whole bathroom was totally wet. The breakfast was quite good. But they swindled us: we made a reservation for a six-bed room for two nights and when we arrived there they told us that the price they told us was not for the whole stay but just for one night, when they never said something similar prior to our arrival. Finally we had to pay the second night, because it was Easter holidays and every Amsterdam's hostel was full (actually it was the only one with vacancies). If you make a reservation make sureabout the price, otherwise, they'll try to swindle you (and probably they'll do, because it's almost impossible to find a room in Amsterdam without reservation

Reviews.Title: “you get for what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: jade_petty
Reviews.Content: When i arrived at the hotel, i was impressed at the location and the bar inside the hotel was very nostalgic and old school. it was like walking onto the set of cheers. It was lovely. It was a family run business and on the whole i was impressed for Â£50 a night. The rooms however are a different story. There is no toilet in your room and we stayed in room 15 which was practically the attic. I have read about anne frank but i didnt think i would have to endure a night in the attic like she. My dad has never had asthma till he went to the old nickel. I would recommend this hotel only if people was skint and on a strict budget. If not i would pay extra and regretted not reading reviews.

Reviews.Title: “This is definetely a stag do/group orientated hostel!”
Reviews.Author: Tiggerchick
Reviews.Content: This place is very convenient for the train station which is why we chose it for the last night of our stay in Amsterdam. This also means it's right in the heart of the noise and there's no getting away from the rowdy people outside, except listening to the rowdy people inside this place. It's a hostel but has some twin rooms. We stopped in a twin room, which was tiny and a weird size so we weren't able to put the beds together to pretend it was a double. There was a shower and toilet on each floor (beware the wet floor in the toilet - yuck!). The stairs in this place are very steep. Our room was on the same floor as 2 dorm rooms that had noisy groups in so we were hardly able to sleep as there was constant shouting and slamming doors until about 5am. Funny enough, we were the only people up to have breakfast in the morning which was fried eggs with a bit of bacon in and cheese on top with bread on the table to have with it. I'd say this place is best suited to those in a large group and just looking to roll to the place and use it to crash (although you'd have to be really careful on the stairs). If you're not planning on going out and smoking and drinking then it's probably not for you as, like us, it's likely to be too noisy for you to sleep. If you're a couple I'd recommend going a little bit further out and staying at the Hotel Hortus (also a hostel, despite the name) as this is in a quieter area and was that bit quieter inside while we were there. We also stayed there during the same break.

Reviews.Title: “last Chance”
Reviews.Author: roonie49
Reviews.Content: Left Harwich on 12th Sep on night boat to the Hook all was well. Caught train all be it late as had bad case of [--].Anyway arrived in the Dam with our 7 strong stag party. Strolled to our hotel called THE BELLVUE a lovely 3+Star hotel right near Central station.Checked in ,well tried to only to find out the stag WAYNE CARROTS Carrington had carefully booked us in for the 12th Nov !!!!!!! So now its 2pm ,no hotel a few spots of rain and to top it off NO HOTELS availiable as it was IBC convention wknd. As we tried and tried nothing was availiable. But in the distance was the neon lights of THE OLD NICKEL HOTEL . As we entered we were greeted by the owner i think.Very smiley . 7 people sorted !!!! Now Rooms were lets say...... dated but in all it was relatively clean, central , 60 euros a night each and had a bar downstairs which is open til 4am. It saved our stag do so thankyou!! Would i take the wife there NO! did i like the shared shower and loo NO!!! But it did the job. Oh and it stunk of skunk big time but we was in the DAM .Breakfst was ok , sort of a bacon omlette type thing with coffee etc.So if your a group of lads or ladies -do it ,but if you like your quality forget it.

Reviews.Title: “One hell of a mini break!”
Reviews.Author: SmugMarrieds20_04_06
Reviews.Content: Came to Amsterdam on a minicruise and decided to book an additional night so we could spend some more time in the city. Booked The Old Nickel through easytobook.com, thought this was an absolutely brilliant website, simple to use, good rates and you didn't have to pay online, just direct with the hotel on arrival. We arrived in Amsterdam on Mon 18th August at around 10am and thanks to fantastic directions from a TA member, we were able to find the hotel which is around 5 mins walk and just across the road from Centraal Station down a little side street. Since we had arrived well before check in, they let us put our luggage in the kitchen while the room was getting cleaned and they told us to come back at lunchtime. Once we had paid and got our keys, we were told we would be staying the other part of the hotel which was a couple of seconds down the street, next to a very good internet cafe and even closer to the Red Light District. We were shown the electronic entry system and told it was open 24 hours and that breakfast would be served in the original hotel bar between 7am-10am. Our room was on the 2nd floor at the back, right next to the toilet and shower room which was handy. Once in the room, up very steep stairs - like most in the area, we found it to be very clean, tidy and with ample space for the night. The only downside was it was a long room rather than a square one and had 2 single beds either side of the room which couldn't be pushed together...however it was funny trying to squeeze on the one bed! The Shower room and toilet were also very clean and the shower room was huge, me & hubby shared a shower and had more than enough room. Once we had got settled in we had a walk through the red light district and had lunch in a little pub, which was when I realised that alcohol is really expensive, just over 10 Euro for a pint of beer and a vodka & coke! We went into the Erotich Museum which was fun and then decided to take a look at a Peep Show which was an experience.....2 euro for 2 mins of a very attractive blonde girl dancing, stripping & pressing up against the window, she could just see us through the glass and seemed very happy.....and suprised....that a couple were watching her, we stayed for about 6 minutes, would have stayed longer but the cabins are tiny :o) After that we walked down Damrak and went into the Sex Museum, pretty much the same as the Erotich Museum but they are both very cheap so it's worth seeing both. We decided to go back to our room at around 4pm so we could chill out for abit, Amsterdam really is a walkers paradise and all the fresh air really tires you out! We were also planning a late night so wanted to have an afternoon sleep and get ready for the night ahead. We did our research before and found out about an interesting restaurant called The Butterfly Thai Cafe where all the waitresses are basically Thai Ladyboys. We headed out there at around 8pm and had a wonderful and very reasonable meal, the food came to 20 Euro and so did the alcohol so our total bill was 40 Euro. It was a great place though and we would def go back. We then took a walk down a few of the windowed streets and had some fun there, again the girls were much more receptive and friendly with me as I'm a girl and part of a couple. Obviously this is an open website so I won't say to much but I will be putting a review on [--] very soon ;o) Also if anyone wants to pm me about this then feel free to! We went back to our room at around 1am so not too late and got a good nights sleep, abeit being very close in a single bed lol. The next morning we woke quite early and went for breakfast around 8am, lovely cleaning lady / cook showed us to a table and immediately bought us a pot of tea and coffee, 2 omlette type things with bacon inside and a few slices of lovely fresh bread, butter, jam and marmalade, yummy! Checkout wasn't till 11am so we made the most of the time to pack and have a refreshing shower. As we booked the minicruise our coach was booked to pick us up for the ferry at 5pm so we had ample time to do abit more exploring. The only downside was we had to drag a suitcase with us all day, we could have possibly left it in the kitchen again but felt more secure having it with us, even if it was abit of a pain. We decided to jump on the Tram and went to The Albert Cuyp Market which was ok, just like a regular market really but it was nice to get away from the hype of the city centre. We spent an hour or so there until around 1pm and then went back to the centre and found a little gem in the form on the pub next to St Christophers Hostel. It was brilliant. full of young backpackers and beers and spirits were buy one get one free so we had a few drinks in there to wile away the hours. I think we may even stay there next time as it has a great atmosphere and rooms (the private ones not the dorms) are lovely and spacious. After stopping off in the peep show again and then popping in to their eqv of tescos for a few goodies for the coach, we junped onboard and headed back to the ferry for a well earned rest :o)

Reviews.Title: “Cheap, clean convenient, and a friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: retrovertigo
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the annex which is about a block away. You have your own key and no curfew, as opposed to the main hotel which has a 4 AM limit to get back in. Also, there are no TV's in the annex rooms. No big deal. The room and shared bathrooms were both very clean. Noise was at a minimum. The only bad thing was the almost vertical stairs, which is typical for the area and not at all a surprise. I've stayed in quite a few one and two star hotel and hostels throughout Europe and can say that this place is slightly above average. I always weigh my ratings heavy on the attitude of the staff. Frank and Ellen, day and night bartender/front desk respectively, were both great. Ask Frank about sports and ask Ellen about vacationing in Egypt. You will get some great conversation along with your beer. The few minute walk from the train station can't be beat either.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect For Me”
Reviews.Author: DanaTeton
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a 4 night stay at the Old Nickel, January 18 - 22, 2008. I was traveling by myself (52 year old male). I've never stayed at the Old Nickel before, and I booked through Easytobook.com, a site I've also never used before. They had a good rate at 185 Euro for the four nights, so I somewhat nervously booked through a website I wasn't familiar with, but called the Nickel the next day to confirm, and they did have the reservation and confirmed the rate. After taking the train to Central Station, it's an easy couple of minute walk to the Old Nickel, but a word of warning...the old Nickel is on a small street that not many people are familiar with, so it helps to have specific directions as to where to walk. I loved this place, but you have to know what you're getting yourself into. The facility itself was quaint and lovely, a nice dark-paneled pub downstairs, with the rooms above, accessed by a buzz-through security door. The usual claustrophobic Amsterdam hike up three flights of stairs to room 12, which was quite nice but VERY VERY small. I happen to like small houses and rooms, but I'm talking small to the point where I could touch the opposite walls without stretching my arms out all the way. We're talking SMALL here folks, so if you're OK with that, go for it. The room was clean, as were the shower and shared bathroom in the hall. I stayed in room 12 on the third floor. I've read some complaints about noise, but my stay was quiet and peaceful. I can sleep through a nuclear explosion, so if there were some loud partyers next door, it wouldn't have bothered me. There was a nice flat panel TV in the room that is impossible to turn on. Ah-Ha! I finally figured out that they give you the remote control at the desk, in exchange for a 10 euro deposit. They gave the deposit back to me (without my having to ask) at checkout...let 'em keep it for a tip. Breakfast was yummy, a fried egg 'n cheese thingie with three slices of white bread, butter 'n jam and a pot of yummy coffee. The location was absolutely perfect, couldn't have been better, right on the edge of the red light district. There was so much to see and do within walking distance that I almost never felt the need to jump a tram or train , but if I did, they're right there. Stay away from the rip-off taxis, and watch out for pickpockets. The area felt very safe and I never felt uncomfortable, even walking very late at night.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Plus”
Reviews.Author: AussieSpike
Reviews.Content: The Old Nickel is located a short walk from the main train station in Amsterdam, just on the edge of the 'Red Light District'. The main area down stairs is a old pub with Dutch charm. The staff are wonderful and make you feel right at home. Many beers are there to be tried and enjoyed. Breakfast is a couple of eggs and bacon with good coffee, just don't ask for anything else. Good stuff. The rooms are comfortable and the beds are just so soft and warm that it takes all of your will power to get out. Toilets and showers are just outside the door and are clean and in good order. Location Location, this place has it.

Reviews.Title: “Few days at old Nickel”
Reviews.Author: magiczouf
Reviews.Content: Old Nickel Is a nice little Hotel . It is very well situated, with a beer pub downstairs (not always nice people .. i've seen drunk people bothering customers, kind of you have to make leave your etablishment ). -The guy was nice, but the woman was not very smily. Sometimes you seems to bother her when ask something. - rooms are very tiny, and not really really clean (dust in the wardrobe and it seems they never clean under the bed) - the problem with shared facilities is when you share it with human pigs that don't clean up the place before they leave. - In my opinion it was very noisy . Both outside and inside ..nothing the owners can do ..but people slamming the door at 7-8 am or making noise because they're drunk at 3am are terrible. I guess some people don't know the meaning of respect. - the worst : I woke up late on one day (spent the night before in airport) and room was just not done during the whole day. I can understand that from a hostel ..not from a hotel. So ..don't expect for a nice and pleasant stay (probably the people staying at the same days were not helping). But it's cheap for amsterdam single and very nice situated.
